tool.name: SAGA.table_calculus.12
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayDATA False isArrayCLASS False output_data_SELECTION $output_data_SELECTION name SAGA.table_calculus.12 DATA $DATA CLASS $CLASS VERBOSE $VERBOSE mRMR_NFEATURES $mRMR_NFEATURES mRMR_DISCRETIZE $mRMR_DISCRETIZE mRMR_THRESHOLD $mRMR_THRESHOLD mRMR_METHOD $mRMR_METHOD prefer $prefer response $response outputType_SELECTION $OutputSection_SELECTION.outputType_SELECTION transmissionMode_SELECTION $OutputSection_SELECTION.transmissionMode_SELECTION

param.name: DATA
param.label: Data
param.help: Data The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: CLASS
param.label: Class Identifier
param.help: Class Identifier The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: VERBOSE
param.label: Verbose Output
param.help: output of intermediate results to execution message window

param.name: mRMR_DISCRETIZE
param.label: Discretization
param.help: uncheck this means no discretizaton (i.e. data is already integer)

param.name: mRMR_THRESHOLD
param.label: Discretization Threshold
param.help: a double number of the discretization threshold; set to 0 to make binarization

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_SELECTION
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_SELECTION
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: Identify the most relevant features for subsequent classification of tabular data.<br/><br/>The minimum Redundancy Maximum Relevance (mRMR) feature selection algorithm has been developed by Hanchuan Peng <hanchuan.peng@gmail.com>.<br/><br/>References:<br/>Feature selection based on mutual information: criteria of max-dependency, max-relevance, and min-redundancy. Hanchuan Peng, Fuhui Long, and Chris Ding, IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, Vol. 27, No. 8, pp.1226-1238, 2005.<br/><br/>Minimum redundancy feature selection from microarray gene expression data,<br/>Chris Ding, and Hanchuan Peng, Journal of Bioinformatics and Computational Biology, Vol. 3, No. 2, pp.185-205, 2005.<br/><br/>Hanchuan Peng's mRMR Homepage at <a target="_blank" href="http://penglab.janelia.org/proj/mRMR/">http://penglab.janelia.org/proj/mRMR/</a><br/>
